item.title: Pokemon GO Ralts Spotlight Hour Guide (August 2025)
item.description:
Ralts is one of the most sought-after species in Pokemon GO, since it can evolve into Gardevoir and Gallade, depending on whether it is female or male. On that note, trainers need to look far and wide for the perfect Ralts to use them in PvP or PvE, and the Spotlight Hour is the best chance they have to catch many of these Pokemon.

With a maximum Combat Power of 609, and average stats, Ralts is not one of those Pokemon that trainers would pick for Little Cup, and when it evolves into Kirlia, things don't exactly improve. Nevertheless, its final evolutions are a different story. Gardevoir is a decent pick to counter meta Pokemon thanks to its Fairy-type, and Gallade is a powerful spammer and shield breaker. So, if players are interested in picking a decent Ralts in the next Spotlight Hour, here's all the information on the event, time, bonuses, and how to get a Shiny Ralts.

Pokemon GO: Ralts Spotlight Hour Date & Bonuses

The Ralts Spotlight Hour in Pokemon GO will begin on Tuesday, August 19, at 6 PM Local Time , and will end the same day at 7 PM Local Time. Trainers have exactly one hour to get as many Ralts as possible, looking for the ideal IV Spreads for PvP, or that valuable Hundo for PvE activities.

The bonus this time is 2x Candy for catching Pokemon , and that means players will be able to collect tons of Ralts Candy. Remember that this also doubles the amount of bonus Candy for using Pinap or Silver Pinap Berries, (though trainers shouldn't waste Silver Pinap Berries in Ralts). For those trainers looking to level up their favorite Ralts, this is a great chance to get that surplus of Candy needed to evolve and train it.

Pokemon GO: How To Get Shiny Ralts

Shiny Ralts is available in Pokemon GO, so trainers looking for a female or male Ralts can encounter a Shiny version of this cute species if they are lucky. The Spotlight Hour doesn't improve the spawn chances (unlike the Community Day events), but with so many Ralts taking over the map, trainers are bound to find one if they look hard enough.

To improve their chances, players should increase the spawning rates even higher by following these tips:

  • Use Incense near PokeStops boosted by Lure Modules to encounter more Ralts.
  • You can get better results by finding PokeStops boosted by the Windy Weather Conditions.
  • Keep walking around the PokeStop to activate the Incense effects.

Unlike other events, the Spotlight Hour doesn't host any Research Tasks that can rewards players with extra encounters with Ralts, though if players use the Party Play feature and band together, they can even exchange information about possible Hundo Spawning Locations. On that note, the Pokemon that spawn from the Incense and Daily Adventure Incense are not shared with other players, so two trainers walking side by side might encounter different Ralts lured by the effects of the Incense, and these will have different IV Spreads.

item.title: Studio Ghibli Fans Are Getting a Stardew Valley-Like Game That May Be The Best of Both Worlds
item.description:
For years, cozy gamers have dreamed of a title that combines the heartfelt charm of Stardew Valley with the magical storytelling sensibilities of Studio Ghibli. That dream may be coming true soon with Starsand Island , an indie life-sim scheduled for release in Q4 of this year.

Starsand Island has had an interesting conception: from starting off as an ambitious Kickstarter project, it has now become a game that is on the verge of release. And even before launch, the game already has potential fans buzzing with enthusiasm thanks to its art style and tone, which feel ripped directly from Ghibli's best storyboards. Still, its systems also promise the same satisfying farming-and-friendship loop that has defined the trademark in cozy gaming for nearly a decade. If it delivers on both fronts, Starsand Island could emerge as a landmark release in the genre.

Starsand Island is a Cozy Life-Sim With Familiar Roots in Stardew Valley

At its core, Starsand Island is a farming and life simulation game very much in the mold of Stardew Valley . Players will take on the role of a new resident on the titular island, where they can farm, fish, explore, and build relationships with a cast of locals. There’s a clear emphasis on slow living and daily rituals, with mechanics designed to let players shape their own pace of play.

While life-sim games are now one of the most crowded spaces in indie gaming, Starsand Island leans on the proven blueprint that made Stardew Valley a sensation in the first place: rewarding progression systems, freedom of choice, and the satisfaction of watching both the farm and the player’s relationships grow over time. Fans of the genre won’t have to test their muscle memory to get comfortable.

Ghibli-Inspired Art and Characters

What makes Starsand Island stand apart is its Studio Ghibli-inspired art style. The visuals immediately call to mind classics like My Neighbor Totoro and Ponyo , with lush watercolor backdrops and whimsical character designs that blend everyday life with just a touch of fantasy. The island itself feels alive, populated by townsfolk that could easily step out of a Miyazaki sketchbook.

Even more than the art direction, it’s the tone that feels indebted to Studio Ghibli. It’s already known as the “anime Stardew Valley ,” and it’s mostly due to the fact that it wears its influences on its sleeves. The character designs are unique without being outright caricatures, with over 40 NPCs to interact with. Plus, the narrative hints at quiet themes of belonging, friendship, and long-term dreams, all hallmarks of some of Ghibli’s most beloved films.

If the game successfully weaves those themes into its mechanics, it may resonate with players looking for more than just another farming sim, which there is surely no short supply of nowadays.

All Eyes Are On Starsand Island's Release

The cozy genre has exploded since Stardew Valley ’s release in 2016, spawning countless farming sims, town-builders, and life-sims. Yet, with that growth has come a sense of sameness.

Many titles copy the surface-level farming mechanics without introducing much new in terms of emotional depth or atmosphere. Starsand Island ’s features have the potential to break that cycle. By marrying the grounded, rewarding loop of a farming sim with other activities, jobs, and the emotional richness of Ghibli-inspired storytelling, it could push the genre in a more narrative-driven direction. In short, it promises both comfort and wonder: a balance that will be incredible to strike.

A Potential Hit in the Making

In this genre, execution is everything. While the previews and trailers highlight a game brimming with promise, fans of the cozy game have been burned before by titles that looked magical during conception but stumbled at launch. Still, the timing for Starsand Island couldn’t be better.

With Stardew Valley creator Eric Barone still working on Haunted Chocolatier , there’s a gap in the cozy space waiting to be filled.

Meanwhile, the cultural cache of Studio Ghibli has only grown thanks to the studio’s enduring legacy worldwide. Starsand Island sits at the intersection of both trends, giving it a unique opportunity to capture a broad audience.

The Best of Both Worlds

If Starsand Island sticks the landing, it could become more than just another Stardew Valley -like game. For Ghibli fans, it offers a way to step into the kind of whimsical but grounded world that has enchanted audiences for decades. For Stardew fans, it promises another fix of the farming, building, and relationship mechanics that defined an era of indie gaming.

That combination of comforting gameplay with a world that feels alive and meaningful could make Starsand Island one of the most exciting cozy releases in years. With its release set for late 2025, the wait won’t be long to find out whether this little island can truly deliver the best of both worlds.

item.title: Wuchang: Fallen Feathers Mod Lets Players Roll Back Controversial Patch 1.5 Changes
item.description:
A newly released Wuchang: Fallen Feathers mod allows players to roll back the controversial update 1.5. As such, the add-on serves as a timely and no-nonsense response to the recently implemented Wuchang: Fallen Feathers censorship.

Developer Leenzee Games released the latest Wuchang: Fallen Feathers update on August 12. Identified by version number 1.5, it introduced sweeping gameplay and narrative changes that quickly divided the player base. Most notably, certain NPCs and bosses were made immortal, preventing them from dying even after defeating them. Rather than perishing, a defeated unkillable character will become "exhausted," delivering new lines of dialogue that shift the tone of the story somewhat. Immortality bestowed by the 1.5 patch was reserved for historically important figures, such as Emperor Chongzhen and Liu Wenxiu. The move has sparked significant fan backlash, largely driven by the perception that the developer caved in to a small minority of Chinese players upset about the game's brand of historical fiction.

Wuchang: Fallen Feathers Gets Anti-Censorship Mod

With the barrage of fan complaints still ongoing, one tech-savvy player has now decided to take matters into their own hands and yank the censorship out of the game. This is now possible using the "Rollback censorship patch" add-on by Nexus Mods user DarkmoonBlade, which materialized less than three days after the controversial patch was rolled out. The mod has already been downloaded hundreds of times, underscoring how widespread dissatisfaction with the 1.5 update has become. In comments accompanying the release, DarkmoonBlade criticized the August patch, positing it has "ruined the game's story and immersion" by replacing pivotal deaths with inconsequential dialogue.

How To Roll Back Wuchang: Fallen Feathers Censorship Update

  1. Extract the 7z archive into the game’s root folder which defaults to SteamLibrary\steamapps\common\Wuchang Fallen Feathers (same directory as Project_Plague.exe)
  2. Run WuchangRollback.exe > wait for "rollback complete" message
  3. Disable Steam auto-update under Library > Wuchang > Properties > Updates > “Wait until I launch the game”
  4. Launch the game via Project_Plage\Binaries\Win64\Project_Plague-Win64-Shipping.exe

The mod won't work if the game is launched via Steam or Project_Plague.exe; it must be started via the game's main EXE.

Leenzee Games has yet to address the backlash or comment on why such sweeping changes were introduced. In the absence of official communication, speculation continues that the alterations were motivated by cultural sensitivities, particularly regarding depictions of historical Chinese figures doubling as Wuchang: Fallen Feathers bosses. The developer has so far only committed to further adjustments to the newly added exhaustion animations, citing the vague goal of improving "plot performance." Given the current state of affairs, the likelihood of Leenzee itself rolling back the controversial patch appears slim.

For now, DarkmoonBlade's rollback tool remains the only way for players to experience Wuchang: Fallen Feathers the way it was originally envisioned. As tends to be the case with user-made modifications, the mod is exclusively compatible with the PC version of the recently released soulslike.

item.title: Disarming as It is, Cyberpunk 2077’s Proposed Sequel Title Could Be a Boon
item.description:
Cyberpunk 2077 and its enduring legacy are ironically only beginning to flourish with a second season of Cyberpunk: Edgerunners and a sequel currently in early development stages. Plus, with all the substantial patches and updates that the game has received to date, including Cyberpunk 2077 ’s 2.3 Update, much less its beloved and game-changing Phantom Liberty DLC, the shape of and reception toward Cyberpunk 2077 couldn’t be further from what they were at launch, in the best ways imaginable. And, as the franchise evolves, it’ll be interesting to see what twists and turns it makes.

For example, the sequel to Cyberpunk 2077 , while simultaneously codenamed Project Orion , is reportedly being dubbed Cyberpunk 2 by CD Projekt Red as it enters pre-production. It’s unclear whether CD Projekt Red will reliably stick with Cyberpunk 2 as the sequel’s title, but, if so, there could be an intriguing implication regarding the series overall, as well as an inherent question about when Cyberpunk 2 could be taking place in the IP’s greater mythos.

Cyberpunk 2077’s Title Plants It in Continuity

In essence, the specificity of the year 2077 is more or less redundant. If never prescribed a particular year, Cyberpunk 2077 ’s story could be largely unaffected at face value while players enjoy the cybernetic sci-fi world they’re inhabiting. However, for anyone who’s obliged to dive deeper into the overarching narrative’s lore, and certainly the history of Night City—ostensibly discretionary content—it makes sense to stamp a date on the game’s events.

If nothing else, ‘ 2077 ’ was a great ice-breaker, allowing for the necessary exposition and baseline that subsequent stories, including Netflix’s Cyberpunk: Edgerunners , could extrapolate from.

This way, what has occurred in the last three decades can be discerned to reach the condition that the North Californian megacity finds itself in, which is distilled significantly throughout Cyberpunk 2077 ’s three Lifepath prologues and each setting players may explore. Indeed, now that the dust has settled and a burgeoning landscape has been developed, CD Projekt Red can be free to widen Cyberpunk ’s world as much as possible and continue adding more meat to its bones with events that are either set before or after the year 2077.

Cyberpunk 2 Forgoing ‘2077’ Can Push the Brand in a Broader Direction

Conversely, it may no longer be remarkable to know what year a Cyberpunk story takes place in, barring any massively polarizing story choices, be it a prequel or sequel, now that there is a firm comprehension of Night City in place that can be as superficial or elaborate as players need it to be in order to immerse themselves. A direct sequel reprising Cyberpunk 2077 ’s V, for instance, probably wouldn’t require a timestamp in the title to instantly embed its place in the timeline.

There’s frankly no telling how or when Cyberpunk 2 intends to reinsert players into the dark sci-fi universe CD Projekt Red has conjured. Yet, making that a transparent distinction might not be as impactful anymore. It should always be important or entertaining to learn about how the state of the franchise’s world has been affected by external and internal events, especially when there’s an open world provided to players that’s teeming with rich detail and characters, but Cyberpunk 2077 ’s worldbuilding would’ve failed its job if it didn’t apply a formidable framework from which CD Projekt Red could withdraw its leash in Cyberpunk 2 .

The sequel to Cyberpunk 2077 , while simultaneously codenamed Project Orion , is reportedly being dubbed Cyberpunk 2 by CD Projekt Red as it enters pre-production.

To be fair, a brand-new location, such as Cyberpunk 2 ’s “Chicago gone wrong,” would likely demand its own hearty helping of rich backstory and environmental storytelling. The only difference, then, is that it may not need to pin itself to a specific year in Cyberpunk ’s lore and documented history to achieve that.

item.title: Weirdest Open-World Games
item.description:
Given how regimented AAA game development has become, there may be a shortage of big-budget games in the industry that are weird. This is why players will love any experimental open-world game that tries to be as quirky as possible.

These open-world games are a joy to play because of how delightfully weird they are. It makes for a much-needed change from other games in the genre that feel too similar and blend into each other.

Westerado: Double Barreled

A Unique Western Open-World Game With Immense Replay Value

Westerado: Double Barreled
Indie Games
Action-Adventure
Systems
Released
April 16, 2015

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
t
Powered by

Players who want to check out a unique indie open-world game that barely takes a few hours to complete and changes the villain of the game every single time will have a great time with Westerado: Double Barreled .

After a mysterious person causes the protagonist's family to die as their home is burned down, they must embark on an investigation to get revenge. A string of missions across many locations will give players the clues they need to nail down a suspect, who must be chased in a dazzling endgame sequence before the title finally draws to a close.

Goat Simulator 3

An Open-World Game That's Weirdness Personified

Goat Simulator 3
7 /10
8.5 /10
Released
November 17, 2022

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
t
Powered by

Players will love Goat Simulator 3 for being one of the most non-serious open-world games players can get their hands on. Players control a chaotic goat hell-bent on destroying anything and everything in its way as it completes various challenges in the world.

From using jetpacks to latching onto anything with their tongues, there's no shortage of goofy things to do in Goat Simulator 3 . Players will love doing the weirdest things possible to get higher scores and understand why players have a soft spot for this meme game.

Far Cry 3: Blood Dragon

Fans Miss The Time When Ubisoft Developed Such Weird and Humorous Open-World Games

6 Images
6 Images
Far Cry 3: Blood Dragon
8 /10
9.0 /10
Released
April 30, 2013

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL

ESRB
M For Mature 17+ Due To Blood, Partial Nudity, Sexual Content, Strong Language, Violence
Powered by

A legendary standalone expansion that fans loved when it came out, Far Cry 3: Blood Dragon pays homage to classic action tropes and old-school movies while using a unique retro-futuristic art style to make the game look downright surreal.

This makes for a memorable ride as players control Sergeant Rex "Power" Colt and use the titular Blood Dragon in combat, which just so happens to be a giant mechanical dinosaur that shoots lasers out of its eyes. All of this makes it clear that Blood Dragon is a refreshingly weird game, and it's a shame that Ubisoft never takes such risks anymore.

Deadly Premonition

A Game Inspired By Twin Peaks Was Bound To Be Bizarre

Deadly Premonition
7.5 /10
Released
February 23, 2010

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M For Mature 17+ due to Blood, Intense Violence, Partial Nudity, Suggestive Themes
Powered by

Deadly Premonition is one of the most divisive open-world games ever made. However, if players love SWERY's quirky game design, then they'll love what this title brings to the table.

Players must solve a murder case in a decidedly weird town with too many quirky residents to name. The weird conversations and surreal moments of this title help it stand out as one of the oddest open-world games players can get their hands on.

Pathologic 2

Personifies The Term "All The World's A Stage"

8 Images
8 Images
Pathologic 2
9.3 /10
Released
May 23, 2019

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
Mature 17+ // Blood, Language, Partial Nudity, Violence
Powered by

Pathologic 2 stages the entire game like an elaborate theatrical play, which should make it clear just how weird this game is. Players must explore a town ravaged by the plague and figure out the reason for this affliction, but this is easier said than done.

Conversations are odd, combat is brutal, and death leads to penalties that make the run even harder. All of this ensures that Pathologic 2 will leave a lasting impression on players if its weirdness strikes a chord with them.

Death Stranding

A Game So Weird That It Alienated Players At Launch

Death Stranding
4 /10
28
7.7 /10
Released
November 8, 2019

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood, Intense Violence, Partial Nudity, Strong Language
Powered by

Any game where players can relieve themselves outside in the world and cause a mushroom to grow at that spot is bound to be the epitome of weirdness. This is why Death Stranding can be such a wonderfully odd game.

This elaborate walking simulator alienated many fans when it came out, but players have grown attached to Kojima's newest eccentricity. Carrying a baby around in a hostile world where players deliver packages makes for a refreshing experience that is unlike anything fans have experienced in an open-world game.

Saints Row 4

The Most Bizarre Saints Row Game That Takes Place In A Simulation And Gives Players Superpowers

Saints Row 4
8 /10
7.4 /10
Released
August 20, 2013

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood, Intense Violence, Partial Nudity, Sexual Content, Strong Language, Use of Drugs
Powered by

Both Saints Row 3 and 4 can win the award for being one of the quirkiest games to ever exist. However, the fact that Saints Row 4 takes place in a simulation after an alien species has taken over the world and lets players use superpowers makes it a very odd title indeed.

Players will love controlling Playa as they team up with other members of the 3rd Street Saints and try to save humanity from the simulations that the Zin have imposed on them. The game is full of its fair share of odd moments that make it a refreshingly weird package that fans will have a great time with.

Disco Elysium

Revels In Its Surreal Weirdness That Forms A Huge Part Of What Makes This Game Special

Disco Elysium
9 /10
12
9.6 /10
Released
October 15, 2019

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M For Mature 17+ due to Blood, Sexual Themes, Strong Language, Use of Drugs, Violence
Powered by

Disco Elysium revels in its weirdness from the very moment players assume control of a half-naked cop who has lost his memories. The fact that his psyches talk to him makes every conversation a fascinating affair as players figure out the best way to move forward in their murder investigation.

As eccentric as Harry may be, he's still enough of a competent detective to convince Kim and the others to rely on him. He eventually recovers his memories, finds the killer, and lets players enjoy a memorable conclusion to one of the greatest open-world RPGs of all time.
